Sheet1.Policy Text: Email At www.enginsoft.com , the privacy of our visitors is of extreme importance to us. This privacy policy document outlines the types of personal information is received and collected by www.enginsoft.com and how it is used.   The purpose of this document is to provide you with information about how we at EnginSoft use and process the personal data we collect when you visit and use the EnginSoft website(s) including but not limited to www.enginsoft.com (our “website(s)”), in accordance with EU Regulation no. 679/2016 and with Italian Legislative Degree no. 196/2003. Data Controller When you visit and interact with our website(s), we use various technologies to collect information about you and your use of our website(s) that may either identify you or make you identifiable.  In terms of the EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), the controller of your data (personal information) is EnginSoft SpA which has its registered offices in Via della Stazione 27, Frazione Mattarello, 38123, Trento, Italy, and the tax identification number (P.IVA) 00599320223.  Data Protection Officer To contact the Data Protection Office, please contact EnginSoft SpA at its registered offices in Via della Stazione 27, Frazione Mattarello, 38123, Trento, Italy. Telephone: +39 0461 915391 . Email: info@enginsoft.com  Data Processing Location The processing of the data related to the services provided by this web site / (these web sites) take/(s) place at EnginSoft\'s registered offices and is only handled by the technical personnel in charge of processing, or by specific individuals in charge of occasional maintenance operations. We do not communicate or disseminate any of this data, except in those cases where it is expressly communicated to the user or disclosure is required by law. The personal information (data) we collect is only used for the purpose of providing you with the service or product you requested, and is only disclosed to third parties when it is strictly necessary for that purpose or in order to fulfil support and service obligations to the user  Types of Data Processed Navigation Data The technologies, computer systems and software used to enable this website to operate correctly may log certain types of personal information transmitted to us by your browser and the related Internet communication protocols. While this information is not collected to be associated with you specifically, it might allow you to be identified after being processed and cross-referenced with data held by third parties.  This category of data includes IP addresses and/or domain names of the computers you used to connect to the website(s), the URI (Uniform Resource Identifier) addresses of the requested resources, the time of the request, the method used to submit the request to the server, the size of the file obtained in the reply, the numerical code indicating the status of the response from the server (successful, partial, error, etc) and other parameters relating to your operating system and your IT environment.  This data is only used to obtain anonymous statistics on the use of the site and to check that the site functions correctly. The data may also be used to ascertain responsibility in case of hypothetical cybercrimes against the site.  Data Users Voluntarily Supply of information The optional, intentional and voluntary supply of information via forms on the website(s) and sending of electronic mail to the email addresses listed on the website(s) will automatically lead to the capture and processing of those email addresses (to provide the service and/or respond to requests), as well as any other personal data or information included in the email or attachments.  Cookies Optional Provision of Data In addition to Navigation Data, the user may voluntarily provide personal information via forms on the website(s) to request/download information about EnginSoft services/products and related services/products, or by means of direct contact with the various offices to request informative material in addition to other means of correspondence where consent has been granted. Failure to supply this personal information may make it impossible for EnginSoft to provide the service/product(s) requested. A summary of information regarding the particular service/product(s) on request will be displayed or provided on the related sections or pages of the website. Upon submission of providing personal data and where stated, periodic emails based on your interest may be sent to you. If you are an EnginSoft customer or have communicated with EnginSoft within the past 3 years, you may receive emails from EnginSoft staff based on your interest, this can include, new service/product updates, commercial offers/discounts, customer case studies and other commercial emails considered relevant. We strive to ensure all communications are relevant and allow the user to easily opt-out or withdraw from our communications are any time either by unsubscribe links or by sending an email. Data Processing Methods EnginSoft recognizes that the appropriate protection, management and handling of your our personal information is important, where the use of technology tools are concerned, data is only stored for the time strictly necessary to achieve the purpose for which it was collected.  EnginSoft adopts specific security measures designed to prevent data loss, the improper or unlawful use of personal data, and/or unauthorized access to the databases.  In instances where access to particular services is subject to registration with your personal information, EnginSoft stores the technical data related to the connections (log) to allow for security checks required by law and to improve the quality of services we provide. Registration forms Your Rights as a User of EnginSoft\'s Website(s) You have the right, at any time, to obtain confirmation of the existence or non-existence of any personal information records, to know its content and origin, to verify its accuracy, and to request to complete or update it, or to correct it (in terms of articles 15 et seq. of EU Regulation 2016/679 and of articles 7 et seq. of Italian legislative decree no. 196/2003).  The same article also guarantees you the right to request for data to be erased, anonymized, or blocked from any data processed in violation of the law, as well as to object to the processing of this data in all instances, for legitimate reasons.  You can exercise any of these rights by sending an email to info@enginsoft.com . Cookie Policy This section provides users of the site with some information about the use of cookies, in terms of articles 13 and 122 of Italian Legislative Decree 196/2003 (the "Privacy Code"), and in compliance with the regulation issued by the Italian data protection authority (Garante della Privacy) on 8 May 2014. What are Cookies? Cookies are small text files sent by a web server (which is the computer that runs the website you are visiting) to your device’s web browser (eg. Internet Explorer, Mozilla Firefox, Google Chrome, etc.), which are stored on your device; they are re-sent to the website at every subsequent visit. While navigating the website, the user\'s device may also receive cookies from different websites ("third party cookies"), set up directly by the operators of those websites and used for the purposes and according to the procedures defined by those operators. Types of Cookies Essential Technical Cookies These cookies are necessary for the site to function properly. Privacy Policy Prowinch, LLC. Prowinch, LLC. (“Prowinch”) shares your concern about the protection of your personal information online. This statement summarizes our policy regarding the privacy of information we collect on our site. 1.1 Information Collected or Tracked by Prowinch. If you provide Prowinch with personal information, we may retain and use that information for several purposes. For example, we may use your personal information in order to process and fulfill any transactions, services or requests for information that you request. We may also use personal information to ensure compliance with our policies and applicable law. 1.2 Personal Information. You are not required to provide any personal information in order to obtain general access to the Prowinch Website. However, in order to access certain information, services or features contained on www.prowinch.com (“Prowinch Website”), Prowinch may require you to provide personal information such as your name, email address, mailing address and telephone number. Prowinch may keep a log of account information for an indefinite period of time, in Prowinch’s sole discretion. 1.3 Tracking Information. Tracking data consists of individual tracking information and aggregated tracking information and is automatically gathered using “cookies”. A cookie is a small data file containing information such as a user’s login name that is written to the user’s hard drive by a Web server and used to track the pages visited. Cookies used by Prowinch are encoded and contain a unique digital signature to prevent tampering. They do not contain subscriber passwords. The individual information gathered in this manner is used for internal purposes only, such as accessing a user’s account information. Prowinch also uses the information on an aggregate basis, to track the readership of stories and analyze traffic patterns on the Prowinch Website. In addition, advertisers that serve ads onto Prowinch site may use their own cookies. 2.1 Use of the Information. Prowinch uses information obtained from its users to enhance their experience on the Prowinch Website. Prowinch does not rent or sell any personal information about subscribers or other users. As a general rule, Prowinch will not disclose any personal information to any third parties, except when Prowinch believes in good faith that the law requires it, or if the subscriber has given permission. Tracking information is used to create aggregate reports on user demographics and site traffic patterns and then provided to our advertisers and partners, enabling them to better target their advertisements to users. None of the information provided to advertisers or partners can be connected to the identities or other personal information of individual users. 3.1 Correcting Information.
